title: BREAKING: Everton's Yannick Bolasie Could Be Missing Till Early 2018
text:
BREAKING: Everton's Yannick Bolasie Could Be Missing Till Early 2018 Thu Feb 23 2017 17:41:02   17:41:02 GMT+0000 (GMT) Ryan Sidle Ryan Sidle in football 
Yannick Bolasie got his break last summer when he made a Â£30 million move from Crystal Palace to Everton however the winger has been hugely unlucky with injuries and now could be out till the beginning of next year! 
The 27 year old was brought by Ronald Koeman in the summer, with the transfer allowing Palace to bring in Christian Benteke from Liverpool, and started the season with 12 appearances for the Toffees. 
Bolasie though suffered a knee injury in the December game against Manchester United, where former Everton midfielder Marouane Fellaini haplessly gave away a penalty for the home team late on in the game to earn them a draw, and had to be stretchered off. 
It was thought that the Congolese midfielder would miss most of the rest of the season with damaged knee cartilage however, according to journalist Ben Dinnery he will now undergo a second surgery that might not see him return till 2018! Yannick Bolasie will have his second knee operation in March. The Everton winger could be out until early 2018. #EFC - Ben Dinnery (@BenDinnery) February 23, 2017 
The surgery is set to take place at the beginning of next month and the tricky winger tweeted at the breaking of the news: See you soon :v:- Yannick Bolasie (@YannickBolasie) February 23, 2017 
Bolasie had already been unfortunate enough to miss the African Cup of Nations this year with Congo surprising Ivory Coast to go through to the knockout stages where they lost to Ghana. 
Bolasie was still able to enjoy his country's performance though: 
(Credit: YouTube ) 
It's such a shame for Bolasie and Everton and we wish him all the luck getting back on his feet and back on the pitch! Sponsored Links
